I played this game on GOD-mode the whole way through!  Seriously, if you are looking to scrutinize the Theology of this game then I implore you to lighten up! The story and design are as simplistic as was Christ's manger.  Let's begin with the design.  The pictures all appear handcrafted as you can see in the previews. It rubbed me in a South Park-ish kind of way which gave me a few reservations because of the liberty South Park takes at ridicule. I kept an open mind because Christ Jesus had one of the greatest senses of humor... it says so in the bible!  Combat is unbalanced. While it was pretty funny to have sent over 320 pixelated enemies to He ll, it was way too easy to beat them and then level up. Enemies are so easy and so I was baffled when I accidentally tumbled apon a boss 'Mazda' and could do nothing. In fact, this made the game very stale, game play-wise.  Finally let us review the Story. At one time in history this story was told by the finest artists of Florence, Italy and funded by the great wealth of the Medici family. For such a great story it probably deserves the finest artists in the gaming industry, the smartest coders, the most intrepid lead designers and enough funding that would rival the bankroll of Bethseda Softworks, Eidos, or any other successful game company.  But same as in the story, God didn't bring a King into the world to be born on a lavish throne. He chose a simple manger with hay. He chose a bunch of dirty fishermen to build a Church for him. And in the case of this game's story, he chose a very very medocre game designer to tell the greatest story ever told! It was very sweet, it warmed my heart to Christianity all over again and I even said a prayer for the designer. For that reason I recommend the game.  Oh and did you notice the game was free?

Going into these games I had little expectations. But man it got going quick. Before I played this game I was not a religious man at all. I started playing and oh fellers let me tell ya the story of Jesus H. Christ unfolded before my eyes in a way I did not think possible. Easily the best story game I have enjoyed. Yes, even better than Witcher 3 which I previously thought had the best story. Jesus Christ RPG Trilogy sets a bar never before seen. When ya first open up the game and try to play you will notice it is a bit hard to get into. But after you spend some time into it the same way Jesus did way back 2016 years ago the path comes to you and you literally feel like you are role playing Jesus Christ himself, our lord and savior. This game should be treated like the bible, and more so as Jesus' diary. You literally get to live his life and shape his legacy. It is fantastic, not even you could do such a thing in the Witcher 3. You will face some of Jesus' greatest enemies and even live out his famous 40 days fasting in the Judean desert. It is crazy immersive. You also get to help out some of the small towns and do such things as turning water into wine for a party they are hosting. There are so many little details outside of the main story, many more than the Witcher 3. I might stop playing the Witcher 3 game all together and commit my life to finding all the secrets and meanings and details in this game. Easily would get 10,000 hours out of it, way more than the Witcher 3 AND all of its DLC's. Overall, it is a great game I 100% recommend to anyone that is willing to invest the hours into learning about our lord and savior, Jesus H. Christ. Amen.

Let me say right off the bat that I'm not the most religious person out there... and that I've seen a lot of off the wall video game concepts... from things like the Binding of Issac to Conker's Bad Fur Day, from Shaq Fu to Grand Theft Auto, from NCIS to Lego Batman... like comic books, if you can imagine something, it can be done in the realm of games being created...  Which brings me... 'Jesus Christ RPG'...  Developed and Published by Wholeton Games, and released for Free on Steam just in time for Easter here in 2016... 'Jesus Christ RPG' is perhaps the most surreal concept I've ever seen...  In short... it's Pokemon mixed with elements The Bible... okay that's silly... more like Final Fantasy meets The Bible.  Yeah that is as surreal as it sounds... as you level up 'Our Savior' he learns how to do his miracles (turn water to wine, heal the sick, etc, etc).... and you battle 'demons' while finding your apostles... and also recruiting your part (consisting of Simon Peter, Mary Magdalene and Judus who joins you no matter if you like it or not)  The game is done on a turn base system, much like many other RPGs, you input your commands when it's your turn, there is some thinking involved to realize how to use everyone's abilities.  Controls are simple, you use the keyboard.... the arrow keys to navigate, enter to select menu options, the ESC key to bring up your inventory, save, status screens... and space bar to interact with objects and people.  However it's the surreal nature of the game that makes it worth playing, there is an actual in-joke about the language (namely that they didn't speak English back in Biblical times), and Mary being apparently an overly common name.  Since the game is free is worth checking out.

One of those games that you really have to try for yourself, when you're bored and just browsing the free and cheap games part of steam. You can look in the sections for the awfully reviewed games, or the wonderfully reviewed games, and somewhere in between you'll find Jesus Christ RPG Trilogy.  Now, you might think to yourself, why exactly would I download this game? I'm not a religious person. I don't need to be indoctrinated.  The answers are very simple.  Do you want hardcore rpg gameplay, where the first thing that happens as soon as you step out of the first town is you are BRUTALLY MURDERED IN THE FOREST BY A PACK OF THUGS? That's not in the bible!  Do you want to recruit a band of disciples? Who doesn't like disciples?  Are you one of those people who likes to cure leprosy?   Do you want to control a character who *literally refuses to fight*?  Do you like chugging down wine in order to fight Lucifer and his demons to cleanse heaven of...   Well, you get the point.  The price tag is on point for the two nights of enjoyment I got out of this bizarrely compelling game. You expect some type of errors, or erratic gameplay, or something wrong with a free title, especially an RPG maker game, but there was never anything wrong.   You have to make decisions that require some thought, you get to baptize people. You even get to grind to beat up tough baddies. Do you really need anything else from an RPG?
